newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada exceeds quarterly U.S. lumber export quota.
newsitem.headline: Canada exceeds quarterly U.S. lumber export quota.

text.p: Canadian exports of softwood lumber to the United States exceeded the bilaterally agreed duty-free quota by 155.3 million board feet in the quarter from July through September, the government said on Wednesday.
Statistics provided by Canada's Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade showed exports of 4,381,587,100 board feet, compared with the quarterly quota of 4,226,250,000.
The extra 155,377,100 board feet is subject to Canadian duty, as per an agreement reached between the two countries that took effect on April 1.
The duty amounts to $50 per thousand board feet.

The department said exports in October "to date" have totalled 222.0 million -- 153.6 million from British Columbia, 22.4 million from Alberta, 13.8 million from Ontarion and 32.1 million from Quebec.
In the past two quarters there has been a one-week lag between the time when lumber crosses the border and the department tallies its export figures.
The breakdown for the July-September quarter was 2.466 billion from British Columbia, 349.6 million from Alberta, 454.7 million from Ontario and 1.111 billion from Quebec.
Department spokeswoman Nicole Bourget said earlier that the government would resume publication of a daily update of the exports on Thursday.
